data.quote: I'm sick of following my dreams. I'm just going to ask them where they're goin', and hook up with them later.
data.about_me: I am a developer who enjoys working with diverse datasets, solving complex problems, and creating solutions that give users the power to gain better insight from their data.  I love the flexibility of working with open source toolsets, processing, resolving, and cleaning data, as well as setting it up for optimal performance.  In addition, I enjoy thinking about how to present and visualize data sets in order to tell a story with data.
data.why_cds: Because I like working in a public startup, helping build from the ground up, and having the power to make an impact within the Department of Commerce.

data.quote: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle.
data.about_me: Some of my passions include user experience design and helping people, and front end web development allows me to practice both. Outside of work I am a musician, runner, and lifelong fan of Mexican food.
data.why_cds: Because each person on the team is extremely talented and dedicated to changing the world, I feel at home amongst everyone.

data.quote: When someone shows you who they are, believe them the first time.
data.about_me: I am a small town boy (his high school was one-hallway in front of a cornfield) trying to live big city dreams using my goverment-issued Macbook to make pretty things that involve HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and soon back-end languages. I incorporate Beyonce into as much of my work as I can - which mostly means listening to her on Spotify, being an avid queer feminist, and being a Crossfit junkie.
data.why_cds: Because I am getting the chance to make our government more impactful for our society, which only encourages larger societal conversations in hopes that we can make progressive changes on a faster timeline.

data.quote: Far better an approximate answer to the right question, which is often vague, than an exact answer to the wrong question, which can always be made precise.
data.about_me: I am a data scientist who has led and deployed projects across 30+ fields, from emergency services to legal affairs to transport economy.  Methodological purity and impact are my driving forces.
data.why_cds: As a Founding Member of the Commerce Data Service, I strongly believe that the CDS has the potential to show what data science can do for public service and precision policy on an unprecedented scale.

data.about_me: I began working in the federal government as a student in the “Pathways Internship Program” during undergrad, and continued my service as a civilian after graduation. I’m an advocate for music, health, sisterhood and doing whatever it is that makes you happy in life. I’m a newlywed to my husband, Troy, who has made my life complete. And we’re busy with enjoying the moment, while planning for our future.
data.why_cds: Assisting CDS with administrative business, means the data work can be put first!

data.about_me: Originally a software developer, I strive to help organizations use technology to deliver the best possible services. I joined the federal government as a Presidential Innovation Fellow, working closely with the White House and the IRS. I'm excited to be with Commerce to contribute to the nation's economic growth and opportunity.
data.why_cds: CDS's focus on data science is unique among federal technology teams. I'm excited for the new services that we can create.

data.quote: The best time to plant a tree was twenty years ago. The next best time is now.
data.about_me: I have been consulting as project manager at different government agencies for the past decade. I’ve enjoyed working on diverse teams consisting of all technical, as well as non-technical staff, in a variety of environments. I believe in the strength of a team, and I am enthusiastic about bringing the knowledge of the team together to achieve Program/Project success.
data.why_cds: Because I am excited to participate in the process of how innovative Data Science can be a part in solving problems by connecting and utilizing data into new meaningful information solutions.

data.quote: Words are, in my not-so-humble opinion, our most inexhaustible source of magic. Capable both of inflicting injury, and of remedying it.
data.about_me: I am a woman of many talents, including music, creative writing, teaching, and programming.  In my work, I strive to find ways to communicate ideas that resonate with individual and audience, encourage critical and creative thinking, and convey a sense of something greater than ourselves.  Whether the medium is a publication, a website, a course, or a musical performance, that is my goal.
data.why_cds: I am passionate about education and thrilled to have the opportunity to help Commerce employees develop new skills in data science, design, and development. CDS is a dream team of data and development professionals and it is a great privilege to be a part of this team, advancing the mission of Commerce as America’s Data Agency.

data.quote: Compassion therefore signifies the maximal capacity of affective imagination, the art of emotional telepathy. In the hierarchy of human sentiments, then, it is supreme.
data.about_me: I like Afro Brazilian martial arts and salty foods. And soul music.
data.why_cds: Data is my middle name. Also, we have a pretty cool team. Come check us out.

data.quote: Sunt hic etiam sua praemia laudi, sunt lacrimae rerum et mentem mortalia tangunt, Solve metus feret haec aliquam tibi fama salutem.
data.about_me: I love working with exotic forms of data. Previously, I served as a Mathematical Statistician in the U.S. Census Bureau, working with the Decennial Census operation, the American Community Survey, Reimbursable Demographic Surveys, and Economic Indicator Surveys.
data.why_cds: Because the CDS offers me the opportunity to encounter an even wider range of data.

data.quote: In God we trust; all others, bring data.
data.about_me: I grew up near Valley Forge, PA, and I was the kid who kept detailed data on the results of living room obstacle courses…which translated into a passion for research design in service to America. I came into gov as a PMF to help develop and implement effective, user-centered policy. Prior to CDS I served at the White House, HHS and HUD, and before that in community organizing, academia, and advanced tech development. I’m a methodologist and a nerd for data collection, design process and process design, cognitive science, organizational behavior, participatory methods, and healthcare delivery.
data.why_cds: CDS brings the best of all these things together into a creative, fun, nimble, super smart and energetic team and I couldn't imagine a better place to do this work!
